title: Loss Prevented
body:
Ok so.....I know a loss prevented occurs primarily when the actual servers have a hiccup and dropout for whatever reason, but my question is this;

Why in holy hell do we not get a loss prevented for having an afk on our team for the ENTIRE DURATION OF THE MATCH?!?

This is some true unfair garbage...trolls are one thing but at least they actually made it into the game before they start acting like parasites....but when our Hecarim just straight up....DOESN'T CONNECT and we spend the entire 23 minutes in a frustrated stupor because its a seriously tilted 4v5 asswhooping you gotta stand up and ask why the hell we don't have our completely unfair loss compensated for?

Now before you say "huurr durr I won a 3v5 u hav no excuse nub"....yeah cool good for you congratulations....but having a SLIM chance of pulling it off is not the point...the point is having an equal playing field at all times to begin with.

replies.body:
>tilted 4v5 asswhooping

I win 4v5 games half the time. You just have to play accounting for what you lost. It's not a 'slim' chance.

But, I think this is a brilliant idea. If someone just does not connect to the game at any point, loss prevent should be enabled for that team if they do lose. Buuuuut, then you'd run into the wall of the team just not attempting to play in the first place because they know they'll get a loss prevented.

Pros and cons.
So easy to abuse, that's why. You would at the very least have to remove the ability to duo queue.
